newsitem.title: JAPAN: Hashimoto says didn't know of move but thanks Peru.
newsitem.headline: Hashimoto says didn't know of move but thanks Peru.

text.p: Japanese Prime Minister Ryutaro Hashimoto said on Wednesday he was not aware that Peruvian troops would storm the Lima residence of the Japanese ambassador but thanked the Peruvian government for the hostage-freeing operation.
"We unfortunately were not told of the operation before the move. I regret this, but we thank the Peruvian authorities for seizing the chance," Hashimoto told a news conference.
"We were truly hoping for a peaceful solution, but that is a notion of someone who is far away at a place where there is a 14-hour time difference," Hashimoto said.
"How can anyone criticise President (Alberto) Fujimori? It is not important whether we had prior knowledge of the move. The important thing is that the hostages were freed."
